intro: Tragacantha alidaghensis, commonly known as the Alidagh tragacanth, is a rare flowering plant native to the Alidagh region of Iran. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant produces a gum resin, which is used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. Its habitat is limited to specific arid and semi-arid environments, making it vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
